column3:
Is there any rendered difference?

 trivial ACK if it's felt this is worth merging, after it's squashed into a single commit.
@fanquake @MarcoFalke @paveljanik Thank you all for the review. Squashed the changes into one commit as per your suggestions.\n
ACK be1d451225cc6d1e4bfe08ac7e67ad0780450f04, verified that the text does not change apart from smartquotes and whitespace.\n
So "quoting" better than ‚Äúquoting‚Äù? Isn't the latter usually preferable, unless when dealing with programming languages? I'm not convinced this is an improvement.\n

@laanwj Hello, both are used in the document, so I chose the one that was more prevalent (dumb quotes) not only in the document, but in the codebase as well - I can switch all of them to one or the other, so they match in this file, however, my personal recommendation (for whatever it's worth üòÄ) would be to use dumb quotes, because it's easier to use on the command line, for example when grepping
